data.title: ETIAS for Australian Citizens traveling to Spain
data.meta_description: Travel to Spain from Australia with the ETIAS travel authorization. Find out how to apply for an ETIAS and what the requirements are for Australians.
data.text:
The ETIAS (European Travel Information and Authorisation System) will be implemented from 2025 and will signify that to travel to Spain from Australia, it will be necessary to obtain an ETIAS prior to departure. Non-EU citizens will have to apply for a Spain ETIAS if they wish to visit Spain after 2025 or other EU member countries that form part of the Schengen area.

ETIAS for Australian citizens is a simple process that consists of filling out a an online application form and awaiting approval. The ETIAS has been in development since 2016 and is expected to come into effect in 2025 in a bid to improve security and border control surveillance in Europe.

Traveling to Spain from Australia with an ETIAS

Up to 50 different countries will be entitled to apply for an ETIAS, including Australia. Citizens will be able to travel to Spain from Australia with an ETIAS that they will have obtained via the online application form process. It is expected that more countries will e incorporated in the list of eligible countries for ETIAS application.

In order to receive an approved ETIAS travel authorization, applicants need to be able to fulfill the basic ETIAS requirements. There is more information regarding requirements and documents required for ETIAS application further below in the Passport and Documents Needed section.

The ETIAS will allow applicants a stay of up to 90 days at a time, although the ETIAS is valid during a period of 3 years. With an ETIAS Spain, you can also travel to other EU countries that form part of the Schengen zone.

ETIAS Application for Australian Citizens

Australian citizens will apply for an ETIAS Spain by filling out an online application form which should be submitted for approval. The data will be cross-checked by European security databases before it is approved. It is important to double-check all information before submitting the application form, as errors can cause your application to be rejected or invalid.

The application form will consist of basic information such as personal details, trip details, and passport details, as well as security questions. The confirmation and status of your ETIAS will be emailed to the email address listed in the application form.

Capital: Madrid

Language: Spanish

Time Zone: CET

Currency: Euro

Country calling code: +34

Population: 46,710,000

Electric socket

Australian Passport and Documents Needed

Australians should check that their passport is valid for at least 3 months from the intended date of departure from the Schengen Area.

In addition to a valid passport, Australian citizens will also need to provide a valid email address for receiving the ETIAS, and a credit or debit card with which they can pay the small ETIAS fee.
